title: CVE6006 Advanced Geotechnical Engineering | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: This module provides an overview of Singapore geology, soil and rock behaviour, site investigation, and evaluation of field and laboratory test results.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
This module provides an overview of Singapore geology, soil and rock behaviour, site investigation, and evaluation of field and laboratory test results.

Effective from AY2025/26 Trimester 2 (January 2026), the Postgraduate Certificate in Civil Engineering will be transiting to Graduate Certificate in Civil Engineering. For more details, please refer to the full notice
This module gives an overview on Singapore geology, soil and rock behaviour, site investigation and evaluation of field and laboratory test results.

It covers the major geological formations in Singapore and the corresponding soil and rock characteristics. It also introduces the basic principles in rock mechanics and their applications to rock slopes and tunnels.

In soil behaviour, the response to shear and compression and the determination of strength and stiffness parameters for different types of soils will be covered. Participants will also learn about the site investigation process which includes detail planning on borehole numbers and locations, the penetration depth, soil and rock sampling and testing as well as the assessments on the reliability of field and laboratory test results.
Civil Engineers, Site Engineers, Field Engineers, Project Engineers
Candidates should possess a Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering
Appreciate the importance of understanding the geological composition of Singapore and its impact on design and construction
Apply the basic principles of rock mechanics to solve simple problems involving rock slope, mined tunnel and rock cavern
Appreciate the importance of understanding how soil behaves when subjected to external pressure and its impact on design and construction
Prepare a site investigation plan to determine the subsurface soil and rock conditions and the corresponding engineering design parameters
Assess the reliability of field and laboratory test results

Dr. Sigl graduated as Diploma Engineer (MSc) in 1985 from the Technical University of Graz (Austria), in geotechnics and soil mechanics and in 1991 he achieved the PhD in mining engineering at the Mining University of Leoben (Austria). Oskar’s 30 years of experience cover a wide range of projects such as subways, railways, roads, power transmission cables, sewerage mains, underground storage schemes and caverns. Oskar has been working in Singapore since 1997, where he was involved in the detailed design of almost all major underground infra structure projects. This includes the MRT lines, high voltage transmission cable tunnels, underground expressways and deep sewer tunnels. Outside of Singapore, Dr. Sigl was involved in leading roles in the design of underground transportation systems in Dubai, Perth, Brisbane, Sydney, Hong Kong, Kuala Lumpur as well as the design of underground oil and fuel storage cavern schemes in Saudi Arabia, India and the UAE.
Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology
Professor, Engineering, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr Wong Kai Sin specialises in geotechnical engineering. His areas of specialisation are deep excavation, building foundation, soil improvement, land reclamation, slope stability, ground settlement, site investigation, site characterisation, soil testing and soil-structure interaction problems.  Dr Wong graduated in 1972 with a BS degree from the University of Illinois. He received his MS and PhD degrees from the University of California at Berkeley in 1975 and 1978 respectively. He practiced geotechnical engineering in California before joining NTU in 1984. He left NTU in 2010 and is currently teaching at SIT as well as actively participating in consultancy works.
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who:
Attend at least 75% of the module; and
Undertake and pass credit bearing assessment (worth 6 credits) during the module, which can be stacked towards the Postgraduate Certificate in Civil Engineering
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
The full fee for this course is S$3,606.88.
Fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
There are no upcoming course runs at the moment.
Subscribe to our mailing list to learn about the latest dates as soon as they become available.

The Postgraduate Certificate in Civil Engineering is designed to equip engineers with specialised technical and practical skills to help the industry address increasingly complex civil engineering problems in a creative and sustainable way.
What is the prerequisite knowledge for the course?
Students should be familiar with basic design rules from Eurocodes.
Is any software required for the software?
Any analysis software used will be provided as part of the course.
Readying SIT's Civil Engineering Graduates for the Future Workforce
SIT's lifelong learning division lays the foundation for Class of 2020 Civil Engineering graduates to attain their Professional Engineering qualification.
This module deep dives into the design of shallow and piled foundations, and how they minimise the risk of catastrophic failure and excessive settlement.
CVE6002 Design of Steel and Composite Structures
This module covers fundamental approaches to designing steel-concrete composite buildings in accordance with EC4.
TE1 – Geology of Singapore and Tunnel Design (Exam-Only Pathway)
This exam-only pathway (TE1 – Geology of Singapore and Tunnel Design) is required for engineers looking to register as a Specialist Professional in Tunnelling Engineering.
This module covers structural stability, dynamic problems, and developing fundamental equations in civil engineering.
This is the second module of a three-module course that prepares candidates for the Specialist Registration Examination in Tunnel Engineering.
TE3 – Tunnelling Operation and Impact Assessment (Exam-Only Pathway)
This exam-only pathway (TE3 – Tunnelling Operation and Impact Assessment) is required for engineers looking to register as a Specialist Professional in Tunnelling Engineering.

Exciting news! We are introducing new micro-credentials in Electrical and Electronic Engineering & Infrastructure and Systems Engineering. Be among the first to know by registering your interest today!
